errors.error_description: The instructions for local development incorrectly state to run `pip install -e .` before cloning the repository, which will fail because the necessary `setup.py` file is not present.
correction_candidates: Combine the commands into a single line: `git clone https://github.com/ai4co/rl4co && cd rl4co && pip install -e .`
Swap the two lines. The `git clone` command must be executed before `pip install -e .`.
Add `python setup.py develop` after the `git clone` command and remove `pip install -e .`.
errors.golden_answer: Swap the two lines. The `git clone` command must be executed before `pip install -e .`.

errors.error_description: The README provides an incorrect file path to the experiment configurations directory, referencing `config/experiments/` instead of the correct `configs/experiment/`.
The command for a hyperparameter sweep uses an incorrect syntax `lr=[...]`. Hydra expects a comma-separated list for multirun sweeps, not a Python list format.
correction_candidates: Change `-m` to `--multirun` and use the original syntax `model.optimizer.lr=1e-3,1e-4,1e-5`.

errors.error_description: The `pip install from source` command provides an invalid git URL, missing the `.git` suffix, which will cause the installation to fail.
correction_candidates: Add the `.git` suffix to the URL: `pip install -U git+https://github.com/ai4co/rl4co.git`.
Remove the `git+` prefix from the URL.
Replace the command with `pip install -U rl4co --index-url https://github.com/ai4co/rl4co`.
Add `@main` to the end of the URL to specify the branch: `pip install -U git+https://github.com/ai4co/rl4co@main`.
errors.golden_answer: Add the `.git` suffix to the URL: `pip install -U git+https://github.com/ai4co/rl4co.git`.
